source.name: Loop PIL
source.instructions: **In the following code snippet, what should the loop parameter be set to in order for it to loop indefinitely ?**
source.text:
```python
output_gif = "rotating_earth.gif"
resized_earth_images[0].save(
    output_gif,
    save_all=True,
    append_images=resized_earth_images[1:],
    duration=100,
    loop=<<<0>>>
)
```
source.guidance: The loop parameter is used to specify the number of times the animation should loop. In this case, the value of `loop` is set to `0`, which means that the animation will loop indefinitely. If you wanted the animation to loop a specific number of times, you could set the loop parameter to that value (e.g., `loop=3` would make the animation loop three times).
